intro: Chilita hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy chilita, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is notable for its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its native arid environment. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Chilita hirsuta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
